_escrow

nodes.documentation: @dev Cancels an auction unconditionally.
nodes.name: _cancelAuction

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct ClockAuctionBase.Auction storage pointer) view returns (bool)
function (struct ClockAuctionBase.Auction storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

nodes.documentation:
@dev Computes the price and transfers winnings.
 Does NOT transfer ownership of token.
nodes.name: _bid

nodes.documentation:
@dev Removes an auction from the list of open auctions.
 @param _tokenId - ID of NFT on auction.
nodes.name: _removeAuction

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns true if the NFT is on auction.
 @param _auction - Auction to check.
nodes.name: _isOnAuction

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns current price of an NFT on auction. Broken into two
  functions (this one, that computes the duration from the auction
  structure, and the other that does the price computation) so we
  can easily test that the price computation works correctly.
nodes.name: _currentPrice

nodes.documentation:
@dev Computes the current price of an auction. Factored out
  from _currentPrice so we can run extensive unit tests.
  When testing, make this function public and turn on
  `Current price computation` test suite.
nodes.name: _computeCurrentPrice

nodes.documentation:
@dev Computes owner's cut of a sale.
 @param _price - Sale price of NFT.
nodes.name: _computeCut

nodes.documentation:
@title Clock auction for non-fungible tokens.
 @notice We omit a fallback function to prevent accidental sends to this contract.
nodes.name: ClockAuction
ClockAuction

nodes.documentation:
@dev Remove all Ether from the contract, which is the owner's cuts
  as well as any Ether sent directly to the contract address.
  Always transfers to the NFT contract, but can be called either by
  the owner or the NFT contract.
nodes.name: withdrawBalance
createAuction
bid

function (struct ClockAuctionBase.Auction storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

nodes.documentation:

 @param _tokenId - ID of the token price we are checking.
